text: Jan Sindewint, Latinized Joannes de Dunis (died 1319) was a monk of the Cistercian Abbey of Dunes in the County of Flanders, and from 1311 a professor of theology at the Collège Saint-Bernard in the University of Paris.Adriaan Pattin, "Sindewint, Jan", Nationaal Biografisch Woordenboek, vol. 16 (2002), 687. In 1311 he acquired the use of the books of the recently deceased Jan van He, a monk of Ter Doest Abbey who had taught theology at the Collège de Sorbonne from 1303 to 1306.Adriaan Pattin, "He, Jan van", Nationaal Biografisch Woordenboek, vol. 16 (2002), 426. ==References== Category:Year of birth unknown Category:1319 deaths Category:University of Paris alumni Category:University of Paris faculty Category:Cistercians Category:14th- century Roman Catholic theologians
title: Jan Sindewint
